posts.author: Freaky Grandma
posts.content:
I am not an expert but I don't see why not. These legacy builds seem to be made to be playable from 1, not for maximum power at 40. When you look at the build, she gets some of the good Pally feats like Divine Shield and Divine Might early, and there aren't 100 skill points saved until level 39 like in some builds for servers here.
Probably not the most powerful build ever made, but should work well enough with the OC  (and maybe something like Aribeth's Redemption afterwards, if you make your toon a male).

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
The OC & nearly every module out there (with some rare exceptions) can be beaten by any build or player, no matter how inexperienced someone is. However, that doesn't mean that the build is enjoyable/good. If your intent is to play this build only up to OC or thereabouts, then you are going to have problems with it, the low AB chief amongst them.

You should also consider altering some stats/skills for the purpose of playability/enjoyment from the builds that you see here.
For example, having CHA (16) will enable a romance option with Sharwyn (the Bard) & a maxed-out diplomacy skill will enable you to "have your way" in most conversations with NPCs that you meet (at least if your goal is to play a holy/noble-warrior type of character).

Have fun!
